classmeta.shortdesc: An object representing an event from the windowing system.
classmeta.desc: An object representing an event from the windowing system with data specific to that event.

constructor.shortdesc: Creates a new GdkEvent object for the given type.
constructor.desc: Creates a new GdkEvent object for the given type.

method.shortdesc: Free the event and any resources associated with it.
method.desc: Frees the event, freeing or decrementing any resources associated with it. Note that this method should only be called on GdkEvent objects returned from methods or functions such as Gdk::event_peek(), Gdk::event_get() and Gdk::event_get_graphics_expose().

method.shortdesc: The get_axis() method returns the axis value for the axis use specified by axis_use from an event structure.

desc.para: The get_axis() method returns the axis value for the axis use specified by axis_use from an event structure. Otherwise it returns FALSE.

method.shortdesc: Returns an array of the event coordinates.
method.desc: Returns an array containing the x and y coordinates of an event relative to the event GdkWindow or FALSE if the event did not deliver event window coordinates.

method.shortdesc: Returns an array containing the x and y coordinates of the event relative to the root window.
method.desc: Returns an array containing the x and y coordinates from an event relative to the root window or FALSE if the event did not deliver root window coordinates.

method.shortdesc: Returns the GdkScreen for the event.
method.desc: Returns the GdkScreen for the event. The screen is typically the screen for the event window, but for events such as mouse events, it is the screen where the the pointer was when the event occurs - that is, the screen that has the root window for the event.

method.shortdesc: Returns the value of the modifier "state" field.
method.desc: Returns the value of the modifier "state" field. If the event has no "state" field the empty state value (0) is returned. The "state" field contains a combination of the GdkModifierType constants.

method.shortdesc: Returns the timestamp field from the event.
method.desc: Returns the time stamp from the event, if there is one; otherwise returns 0.

method.shortdesc: Appends a copy of the given event onto the tail of the event queue.
method.desc: Appends a copy of the given event onto the tail of the event queue.

method.shortdesc: Sets the GdkScreen for the event.
method.desc: Sets the GdkScreen to the value of screen.
